articles.author: By Christopher Burbach World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: More people would be let out of jail while awaiting trial under Douglas County pilot program
articles.description: The Douglas County Corrections Department, faced with a crowded and chronically understaffed jail, is leading the effort.

articles.author: By Cheyenne Rowe / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Three Omahans are honored for advancing Martin Luther King Jr.’s vision
articles.description: Deputy Omaha Police Chief Greg Gonzalez, Tanya Burnside with the Douglas County Department of Corrections and civil rights veteran Tommie Wilson were recognized Friday during the Living the Dream awards ceremony at the City-County Building.

articles.author: By Paul Hammel / World-Herald Bureau
articles.title: Douglas County, La Vista-based company defend jail phone call fees
articles.description: In a statement issued Friday, a spokeswoman for the Douglas County Department of Corrections said that the main reason it led the state is because it is the largest correctional facility in the state, with an average of 1,355 inmates.

articles.author: By Nancy Gaarder / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Woman found dead in Douglas County jail cell
articles.description: A woman who had been jailed in Douglas County on suspicion of trespassing has died in her cell.

articles.author: By Christopher Burbach World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Douglas County Jail officers 'worn down' by mandatory overtime, union says
articles.description: Mandatory overtime shifts are placing further stress on corrections officers at the Douglas County Jail — a staff that already is worn thin by a shortage of officers and an unusually high inmate population, union leaders say.

articles.author: By Andrew J. Nelson / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Douglas County inmate, 58, dies in custody after being transferred to hospice
articles.description: A Douglas County inmate died Friday in custody. Charles McNeal, 58, convicted of three counts of sexual assault on a juvenile, was confined to hospice care at the time of his death.

articles.author: By Mara Klecker / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Omaha police arrest 31-year-old man in connection with South Omaha slaying
articles.description: Matthew Arnold was booked into the Douglas County Jail on suspicion of second-degree murder in connection with the slaying of Matthew E. Johnson.

articles.author: By Hailey Konnath World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Sarpy County takes first steps toward building new jail as overcrowding concerns linger
articles.description: Exactly what a new jail will entail — its capacity, location, cost and funding — is up in the air. But the time frame is not. The project's wheels are already turning. A new facility could be up and running…

articles.author: By Paul Hammel World-Herald Bureau
articles.title: Turnover at Nebraska prisons increases to 34 percent, despite state's efforts
articles.description: Turnover for such workers rose to the highest in recent memory, 34 percent, up from 31 percent in 2016. Overtime expenses are also on pace to eclipse the $9.3 million spent during the 2016-17 fiscal year.

articles.author: By Emily Nitcher / World-Herald Bureau
articles.title: Nebraska State Sen. Justin Wayne introduces bill to cap pay of local elected officials at $24,000
articles.description: Wayne said there needs to be a discussion about how much officials at the local level are being paid, and whether the jobs the elected officials are doing should be considered part-time or full-time jobs.

articles.author: By Joe Duggan World-Herald Bureau
articles.title: Senator cites 'fiasco' – 59 calls between inmate and attorney were recorded – in pushing new bill
articles.description: The incident illustrates the need for a law that would ban jails from recording attorney-client phone calls, State Sen. John McCollister said last weekcq during a hearing before Legislature's Judiciary Committee. The Omaha senator included the provision in Le…

articles.author: World-Herald editorial
articles.title: Editorial: A new year, and new goals, for our city, state and country
articles.description: The calendar turn to 2018 offers new opportunities for those willing to seize them. Today we offer our New Year’s wishes for those in position to shape how the year unfolds:

articles.author: Compiled By Dan Golden / World-Herald staff writer
articles.title: Husker overhaul, State Patrol turmoil, downtown development and more of Nebraska's top stories of 2017
articles.description: Beer sales to Native Americans. Prison riots. The Keystone XL pipeline. The list of top stories for 2017 includes its share of weighty and divisive subjects. Here are the news stories of the year, as selected by The World-Herald.
